website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you like the idea of  litter that weighs half that of competing brands; otherwise consider others we reviewed.
pros: It's 50% lighter than other formulas on our shortlist, making it easy to use
Clumps hard and works well for multiple-cat homes
cons: It has the tendency to stick to cats' feet, and tracks more easily than others we tested

customer_reviews.title: Upper respiratory infections
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when this came out because I can't do any lifting. I wish I was as excited about the product after using it. The litter is very dusty. It puts a layer of dusty film over everything in the surrounding area. I have to cover my mouth and nose when filling the litter box because of the dust. Two of my cats developed upper respiratory infections shortly after I started using it, and I believe it was directly related to the product. I used it for several cleanings, but decided it was not for us.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say much good about this litter
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I cannot say much good about this litter. It is lighter... much lighter, and therefore easier to handle. But it does not clump well at all, in fact most of my cat's urine filters through to the bottom of the little box and forms a nasty mud that is difficult to clean out. As for oder control? Fail! With the regular Tidy Cat no oder is detectable. With this one.... phew. I have to burn incense by both of the littler boxes. Needless to say, I will not buy this one again. I'll stick with the regular Tidy Cat. It weights more, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond R. Roewert

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the Orginal
customer_reviews.text: I am a Tidy Cat customer and was very excited about this "light weight" version. I even set it up on auto shipments. I started seeing white clay paw prints on my dark wood floor. I used larger then smaller quantities to see if that would make a difference. I cried uncle when the litter was painted on my cats paw and it took me 30 mins to remove it for the 10th time. Went back to the 24/7 normal formula.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: More tracks than a train system
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this litter might be the devil. It lures you in with its clean, fresh scent and it's ability to efficiently mask odors but it ends up EVERYWHERE. I didn't realize how much of the litter actually gets tracked until I moved and saw the bits of litter tracked across the painted hardwood floor straight to my bedroom as well as across the dark bathroom floor tiles. I ended up buying an extra large litter mat which has helped some, however, I will never buy this litter again. I wish I didn't have so much of it left!
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Be wary if it's your first time buying this!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my cat refused to use this litter most of the time. It also has a noticeable odor right from the start. Perhaps he didn't care for the weight of the sand, in combination with the scent. Urine tends to pool rather than absorb quickly into the litter as it would with other clumping sands. Cat would choose to eliminate waste in this litter only 50/50 of the time. Ensured a clean pan/box with no harsh scented cleaners (hosed off, with mild soap at best), but no dice. All-in-all, would not recommend. Perhaps my cat is fickle, as it certainly prefers the regular clumping litters provided by Tidy Cats. But the lightweight litters are a disaster most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: AmaKind

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering Scent
customer_reviews.text: After using a regular, heavy, clay-based litter, we purchased this product due to the lighter weight. We found the product was not particularly effective at controlling unpleasant odors from the litter box, even though the perfumed scent was overpowering. Instead we had a blend of stinky perfume that permeated the house. We have 3 cats and 3 litter boxes that are cleaned at least twice a day, with large litter mats in front of them. Even so, tracking of the litter was far worse than with the previous product. Although it is heavier - for price, odor control, and less tracking, I am going back to ordering Dr. Elway's Precious Cat Ultra litter.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S. Morehouse

customer_reviews.title: Too scented for me
customer_reviews.text: Very strong scent - it was literally making me ill. But I do live in a very small apartment. It probably wouldn't be quite so overwhelming in a larger place. However, one of my cats started getting sores on his belly a few days after we started using this litter. Since nothing else has changed and he doesn't go outside, I was concerned that he was allergic to this litter, so we switched back to our old brand. Hopefully I can find someone to donate this litter to.
customer_reviews.author: SplashofJoy

customer_reviews.title: It's great if you love the smell of cat pee...
customer_reviews.text: The only positive thing I can say about this is that it is light. It does NOT control smell! I have three cats and sufficient litter boxes that I scoop multiple times daily. The clumping ability is only OK. The smell is so bad that I thought my cats peed somewhere. I never questioned my litter since I keep it clean. It was only in my litter boxes for a handful of days before the smell started. I've scoured my house and cleaned everything trying to find the source of the sink then finally realized it was the litter! I've never had an issue with my entire house smelling before. It's disgusting. I would never recommend this litter to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joy F

customer_reviews.title: the tub was light and easy to carry Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: the tub was light and easy to carry Cons: Easily flew outside of the box and was tracked all in the house. I have 3 long haired cats and it clumped on them and in their paws. I spent a lot of time either picking the litter off of them or getting it out of their paws because they were walking funny or spending too much time grooming them. I don't know about other users but it didn't seem to clump as fast and remained mushy a lot longer so the cats would step in it and get it stuck to their paws. I will be going back to the regular tidy cats product.
customer_reviews.author: Marci C

customer_reviews.title: Price review, not litter.
customer_reviews.text: This is good litter. It works well and keeps all odors at bay. Why ONE star..... The PRICE. Slowly creeping up from around $14 a bucket to over $20. At THAT price, it's NOT worth the money. It's slowly but surely, pricing itself off my, and many others, shopping list. But, like so many others..... it boils down to "whatever the market will bear"...... I live in ALASKA, and even with the store markup.... it's cheaper to get it here. Finding more and more things that Amazon is really "padding" for the "free shipping". Like I wrote.... "whatever the market will bear". Why souldn't Amazon jump on the "gravy train".
customer_reviews.author: Madelene Caselli

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Light Weight LItter
customer_reviews.text: Best cat litter ever! It is very light weight yet still all the use of a product weighing twice as much. Since I don't need to do a lot of heavy lifting, this product is great for me, especially having a three cat household. The cats use it with no problem, and have never turned their noses up to it (you know how they can be picky sometimes). It did take a little adjusting in the beginning because it seemed that they kicked it out of the litter tray a lot more than the other...being lighter weight I supposed...but that's not an issue anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: UGH
customer_reviews.text: My poor cats have clumps of litter ALL over them - on their tummies, feet, etc. It's clumping on the CATS as well as the litter box. I'm so sad, too because the price was amazing for this litter and wanted to keep buying it. Nevertheless, I can't be giving my cats baths (not just because I will surely DIE in the process, but I should not have to) because of their litter matting up their fur. And, yes - it tracks EVERYWHERE like the other reviews are stating. So, ignore the awesome cost and pass this one by. It's not worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Scent and Adequate Clump
customer_reviews.text: Kitty seems quite taken with this litter. We've been using it since we adopted her and have never had a problem. The fresh scent is pleasant and helps masks odors, but it will diminish in ~2 weeks (I will either add more or completely switch out the litter). The scent doesn't seem to bother her at all. This litter seems to clump pretty quick, but Kitty has long fur and little pieces will often get stuck. a quick brushing gets those away. The lightweight feature is a nice touch. It does make the litter easier to pour, and it seems to be every bit as effective as the full weight stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Bounces all over the house. Daily cleaning. Litter stuck to feet.
customer_reviews.text: This litter tracks everywhere. It's so bad. It's like it's made of millions of little bouncy balls. Instead of the normal 5 foot radius of cleaning, I've cleaned up litter all over the second floor, down the stairs and even have some on the first floor. The litter also sticks to the cat's feet when they pee. There's little dusty footprints going all the way down the stairs. I've had litter on tables and chairs and the desk. Seriously, it's the worst. The scent seems very strong compared to the same kind that's not lightweight. I will never buy lightweight again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: Not a lightweight when it comes to odor containment!
customer_reviews.text: I’m what you might call a heavy consumer of cat litter. This cat litter is lightweight, which is nice because my frail arms can easily carry the full bucket up two full flights of winding stairs. As fantastic as this litter is for transportation, that’s only half the battle. While other ‘lightweight’ litters are true ‘lightweights’ when it comes to containing odors, this litter stands strong. A+ overall. Will buy again (and again, and again).
customer_reviews.author: LaFawnDuh

customer_reviews.title: I liked it but the cats did not.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it wasn't as heavy to move around as the regular litter. However, that lack of density ended up being a problem because it can't support the weight of the cat when it enters the box. Their paws sink into the litter more and they didn't like that. The four cats began to just barely enter the box and their bottoms would hang outside the box as they did the deed. This made for a huge mess. I even mixed the light litter with the heavy little and it helped some, but not perfect. I'm back to the regular heavy litter.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn A Webb

customer_reviews.title: Like the lightweight litter, perfume not offensive to us humans or the cats.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the lightweight litters. Yes, cats track it. But they track the heavyweight litters too, the difference is the size of the granules. We have not noticed an increase in tracking that some report. But I admit it may be in part to each person's house configuration. Our cats prefer this litter over heavy weight. We tried switching back and they nearly rebelled over the heavyweight. Also, the perfume in this version of littler is not offensive to us humans or our cats. I like buying the litter in the larger containers for convenience. I wish I could buy it in this size locally, but am happy I can get it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of Purina Tidy Cats LightWeight Clumping Cat Litter. Perhaps I should have given this product a five star rating because it is lightweight, odor free when it arrives, and odor free after my cat uses her litter box. I think no matter which kitty litter I were to buy I'd still have the same problem--litter on the floors. The litter isn't just in the bathroom where her litter box is, but also in other rooms. The litter must get stuck on her paws and get tracked in to other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lakes

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO OPEN THE CONTAINER, Litter gets tracked all over
customer_reviews.text: The lid is extremely difficult to open. I purchased Lightweight Cat Litter because I cannot easily carry heavier litter.The manufacturer puts a tear strip around the top of the container which took many tools to open. The tear strip would not tear. There is a more severe problem of the cats tracking it all over, this does not happen with the heavier stuff.
customer_reviews.author: mcp

customer_reviews.title: Truly lightweight, but keeps the litterbox smelling fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to the heavy old clumping litter after using this stuff! For me, it seems much easier to scoop, and it keeps the litterbox smelling fresh for a long time. We have 3 cats, one who is a "litter kicker" and he isn't quite as messy now that we use this lightweight litter. Pairing this with our new upright litterboxes (Iris) has made for a TON less mess and I also feel like I'm using less litter overall. Definitely a winner in my book - added to my subscribe & save to keep it coming every month!!
customer_reviews.author: bananawest

customer_reviews.title: This kitty litter is by far the greatest! I have about 9 cats
customer_reviews.text: This kitty litter is by far the greatest! I have about 9 cats, and 3 litter boxes in my home and you can hardly tell i have 2 cats! This is lightweight and traps in the smell so I can go at least 1 week without changing! The cats seem to love it as well, since its so light and can pass through their cute little paws so easily. Will continue to buy this litter, and I may even adopt another cat or 2! Thanks Tidy Cats!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin_Marie

customer_reviews.title: Never Again!!!
customer_reviews.text: Never again!!! At first I loved it since it was so much lighter. After using it though it's extremely messy and gross! The litter gets tracked EVERYWHERE!! The dust is insane and can be smelled on the cat hours later. The worse though is when the damp litter (even in a clean box) comes in contact with my longhaired cat and gets stuck in his fur. I had to cut clumps of hair off his behind on several occasions. The final straw was when I had to cut it off his back foot. It was matted in between his toes and extremely painful. I pulled that stuff out of my house within hours! Never again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tracking/dusting.
customer_reviews.text: Let's see. As has been said by a great many before me, this stuff tracks, a lot. I gave it a shot but it's not a fit for my cats. I ended up nicknaming one cat "old stonefoot" after she peed on her paw and got it coated up in this stuff. I lost a lot of blood cleaning that mess up, "old stonefoot" is also "razor claws" and "do not touch my feet" which = much pain. I also noticed it tends to dust a fair bit and found my own respiratory system a bit irritated during box cleanings. As such I'm going back to my former litter choice.
customer_reviews.author: Greffinthenerd

customer_reviews.title: Works awesomely!
customer_reviews.text: This litter works amazingly and smells great also. It's extremely easy to Cary and to scoop up. I've got two non stop bathroom using cats but this litter can keep up with them. Make sure you scoop out the box daily though if you have two or more cats because if you don't, this litter has to be replaced quicker than normal. But if you keep up with it, this litter takes the cake on lasting longer before you have to replace the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Marie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: more like industrial bathroom scent
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT get if your cat is asthmatic! Mine hasn't had issues with the pine pellets in years, but one day after I put this as the bottom layer in his box he was coughing everywhere. My other cat isn't bothered by it though. However, it is SCENTED even though it doesn't say it anywhere on the container-and its not a pleasant scent , more like industrial bathroom scent. bleh. Back to searching for a lightweight litter solution!
customer_reviews.author: Curious Fan

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness it's light to carry, contains odors
customer_reviews.text: Cats seem to prefer the tidy cat brand to other brands of litter. I've tried so many over the years. I wish they would come up with one that ain't quite as dusty, but it does clump well, and most importantly, minimizes the smell. I use a separate litter box for each cat, and it really does help. I've also tried the breeze system, but they don't like stepping on those pellets, so we always come back to using this, I prefer the lightweight litter because as you get older, it's so much easier to lift.
customer_reviews.author: SnowbirdTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best so far!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this find and the fact it's delivered to my door is an added bonus. I am loving the light-weightedness of it - since I recently had major serious back surgery and lifting the heavier stuff just isn't an option - and ridding my house of 2 rescued kitties is even less of an option. Talk about a win/win situation - this kitty litter is a saving grace for all of us and I am so thankful for having found it - and will order again and again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Katkus

customer_reviews.title: Sadly it was so bad that she had to get a bath in order ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because it sticks to my cat's paws due to the high amount of clay. didn't find this out until she was kicking with her back leg trying to get the stuff out of her toe beans. Sadly it was so bad that she had to get a bath in order for the stuff to come off. Now that I know it does it I'm keeping an eye on her feet and waiting to get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for clumping but strong smell
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great, but expensive compared to other brands that aren't lightweight. It clumps really well, I've always had a problem with other non-lightweight brands and not clumping well - the urine would break apart and that's so gross. It's got a somewhat strong perfume-y smell, so don't purchase if that's a deal-breaker for you. I usually mix this 50/50 with the heavy stuff and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Chimney161Top Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: Tracks All Over the House
customer_reviews.text: Strange, I bought a pail of this litter a couple months back and everything was fine. Two weeks ago I started another pail, and I'm seeing my litter paw prints all over the house! Maybe this latest batch has too many fine particles in it. Either way, I'm going away from this litter for good.
customer_reviews.author: ClemDawg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, one draw back.
customer_reviews.text: I think the litter works well, and covers smell pretty decently. It also isn't cloying with cheap perfume. The lightweight is almost like a novelty feature. That being said, I did take one star because the litter is more likely to travel farther when my cat jumps out of the box, and I have had to do a bit more cleaning every day. So, I would buy this if it was on sale super cheap because it does work, but I do not intend to make it my primary choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Shards!
customer_reviews.text: Controls odor as advertised and it is very lightweight. However developers made these pellets too small. My cat tracked them everywhere. They caught in her paws and she shook them out as she left the room. They are hard as a rock and painful when stepped on. Needs to be redesigned. I'm going back to the corn cob litter.
customer_reviews.author: Marie A. Nachman

customer_reviews.title: love the light weight nature of this
customer_reviews.text: love the light weight nature of this...benefits me when adding litter, when scooping litter (definitely makes scooping easier and faster), and later when disposing of litter... Seems as good, if not better, at odor control than the regular clumping litter. Only bummer is that it seems to 'travel' further in the house...stuck between kitty toes... and being lighter, it also gets flung a bit further, with a more agressive-footed feline.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Helwig

customer_reviews.title: I like the other ones that have the handle and are ...
customer_reviews.text: It was convenient in the delivery, but it really did not last that long. I like the other ones that have the handle and are smaller in size - they actually last longer. I have decided to re-purpose the bin for decorations or some other storage. At least it has some use that I actually appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Mozue

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this litter for at least a year now. It has been a Godsend. It makes taking care of my 3 cats a lot easier. In my experience, it has not been 100% dust free, but I think it's as close to 100% dust free as you can get. One thing that has helped cut down on the spread of dust is having an air purifier close by. Their box is very near an outlet so I use a plug-in purifier.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H Bright

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, BEST litter
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats and have tried a multitude of litters. In terms of smell, the litter has a slight clean scent but nothing offensive to us or the cats. Clumps very well and is easy to clean. I find that the litter lasts longer and keeps the house from smelling like 4 cats all the time! The only issue, and it's a trade off I'm willing to make, is that it does "track some." I have mostly carpeted floors so this is not a big problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Becker

customer_reviews.title: Tidy Cats Lightweight Litter is great! Saved $$
customer_reviews.text: Great deal! Saved $5 from previous retail buy of this. I have four cats in the house and this lightweight scoopable litter with Ammonia control keeps my house from smelling like a dirty litter box. :) Believe me, cause we go thru a lot of litter! It was shipped lightning fast and in great condition! My mail lady wasn't thrilled with the slightly heavy package, but I saved money!!!! lolol
customer_reviews.author: MCB catlady

customer_reviews.title: Too dusty and messy
customer_reviews.text: When filling the litter box (I dump right from the bucket), the dust is oppressive - I cough until I gag. That's not the worst part, though. For some reason, this litter sticks to the paws of my scrawny 4 lb cat, and there is litter everywhere. She can't seem to not track litter all over the house; and the worst place is my bed, where she likes to snuggle when I'm at work. I've discontinued my subscription and now need to find a better type of litter.
customer_reviews.author: Volleyball Mom

customer_reviews.title: Dusty
customer_reviews.text: I use it because as a senior, I do not want to lift heavy cat litter any more, especially going up and down stairs, and buying multiple small jugs is too expensive. However, I find this product to be extremely dusty leaving a dusty film over all my furniture. .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... using tidy cats for 10 years and have always loved their product
customer_reviews.text: We've been using tidy cats for 10 years and have always loved their product. My husband purchased the lightweight because the typical containers are very heavy for me to pickup. The litter itself is great, however, the lightweight formula seems to get stuck to my cat's paws easier and they tend to track it all around the house more than the standard litter from tidy cats.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Really meets my kitt's needs and much lighter for me to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I have used tidy cat litter forever. Now, home bound I turned to Amazon to meet my kitty's needs. I got this (new to me) type. I am an older person and the 35 LB buckets were getting pretty difficult for me to lift. I was surprised at the weight and the over all quality of this litter but I would not expect any less from Tidy Cat. I even found opening the litter easier than the heavier buckets. I am really glad I took a chance on LightWeight litter.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Light, but TOO Light
customer_reviews.text: We love this litter because it's LIGHT. Our poor mailman had a break from carrying our previous 14 lbs bag to our door every month! Plus, it was better for us to carry up the stairs. It worked well too. The only thing is that, I think because it's so light, the cats kicked MORE of it OUT the box, which of course is more work for us, plus it's wasteful! So, we ended up going back to our 14 lb bag JUST for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl J

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well and keeps area smelling nice. Only downside of lightweight litter is that it ...
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to fill my cats litter box with this pail being half the weight of normal litters. Clumps well and keeps area smelling nice. Only downside of lightweight litter is that it sticks to cats feet easier and ends up getting tracked around litter box easier. Not a huge issue and ease of use makes up for that small downside. Very good odor control as well. I only have one cat but he can emit a powerful smell and this litter seems to minimize that quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: My cats hate this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cats hate this stuff. They won't use the box... not sure why but think maybe it is the scent, it's kinda flowery. Don't much care for it myself but LOVE the lightweight aspect. I'm a bit bummed. Dang cats...
customer_reviews.author: ZCyclesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Light weight leads to big mess
customer_reviews.text: The light weight is nice when you are lifting it, but iin hte litter box it doesn't work for me as it clings to the cats' paws worse than normal litter and they carry it all over the house. Switching back to the heavy stuff for a cleaner house and more exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great litter!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to be the guy who gets excited about cat litter... but this stuff is GREAT! It clumps well, handles odor well, and is much easier to sift through than other litter. Yes, you cat will probably kick more litter out of the box but that is easily dealt with: Point the opening of the box enclosure towards a wall and leave a foot or so room for you cat to enter/exit. This way all of the kicked litter is in one place and easy to vacuum up.
customer_reviews.author: T. Culbertson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Find a Different Litter
customer_reviews.text: This litter does NOT capture the pee smell at all... It is also tracked so much worse than most litters I have tried. It is the pee smell that kills me. With only one cat, I should not have to completely change the litter out 1-2 times a week. With other litters, I scooped every couple days and changed the litter 2-3 times a month. Ready to have this bucket of litter gone and try something that will actually work..
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: so not all the dirty goes away when you scoop
customer_reviews.text: Oh so torn. This little is so much lighter and easier to work with. But the lighter litter stinks faster. And the clumps aren't as solid, so sometimes they break apart, so not all the dirty goes away when you scoop. But it's just so much easier to work with. So I use it. I've tried other kinds, but keep coming back to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Blythe

customer_reviews.title: Same volume, easier to carry
customer_reviews.text: I usually purchase Tidy Cats for my three girls so I thought I'd try this lighter weight product. It's only a little more expensive than a comparable volume of regular clumping litter. It seems to do as well in absorbing liquids as the more dense product, and the fragrance is similar. My cats were a little suspicious about the difference, but then adjusted quickly. I recommend it for most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Tapir

customer_reviews.title: Strongly perfumed, tracks easily
customer_reviews.text: I normally use unscented litter, so I may be off, but this smells very strong and bothers all of us. Also, not sure if it’s because it’s “lightweight” (first time using lightweight) but it is being tracked out of the litter area significantly more than normal.
customer_reviews.author: E. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for this quantity of the TidyCats lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great value for this quantity of the TidyCats lightweight. I wish it was available to subscribe! I had subscribed for the same quantity of the Glade-scented Lightweight, but my kitties don't like that scent and it caused "issues" (going outside the box) so I had to cancel the subscription and order this one individually. Still a great price, but wish I could just subscribe and forget about it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my cat, I tried numerous different litters and either they clumped well but didn't hide the smell, or they smelled great but didn't clump. I finally tried this and have been using it ever since, for about 2 years now, and I absolutely love it. It clumps amazingly for easy cleanup and it hides all the nasty smells! It neutralizes and sometimes gives off a nice fresh scent. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep smell down
customer_reviews.text: This works nowhere are well as the regular line. Be prepared for a smell all of the time even right after you clean the box. I clean the box every 2 days with one kitty, I ended up cleaning it everyday. Got rid of the lightweight litter and the smell is gone!
customer_reviews.author: J. Crase

customer_reviews.title: Safety &  invrexksnb.
customer_reviews.text: Did 't like the FRAGRENCE or dust from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carole V Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tracking, too perfumy, unremarkable clumping
customer_reviews.text: This litter tracked like crazy all around our house, plus it had a cloying, strong scent. It formed a paste on our cats' paws. It didn't clump solidly. There was a haze of grey clay from their paws on the hardwood in a path from the box to the office for. Unreal! We sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Running Rampant

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used to pick this up at our Sams Club and they stopped carrying it in our store. It was an easy order on-line and came right to the door. This is great, lightweight litter. The lightweight is easier to pick up as far as container weight and I don't have to have help to pick it up and change out the litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Effectiveness is not worth the constant cloying "fragrance" that comes with it
customer_reviews.text: I admit that this is doing a solid job of masking my two boy kittens rather stinky poops (better than some other unscented litters I've tried), but I don't think it's ultimately worth the unbelievably cloying "fragrance" that now permeates our small house at all times. Even my poor cats smell like this scented litter now and it's awful. So yeah, gonna have to go back to a different kind and just endure the stinky poops.
customer_reviews.author: 1979 Semi-Finalist

customer_reviews.title: Good for stinky cats
customer_reviews.text: Don’t care how much more expensive lightweight is compared to the original but it is worth every penny. Smells good unlike my cats poop emoji. I find it odd that a fresh number 2 smells like rancid BO as much as it does poop. Maybe it’s just my cat but this stuff only covers it up if she goes in the box. I’ve found she requires a freshly scooped box often. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty B

customer_reviews.title: LightWeight Clumping Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: First, I have 4 cats and 7 cat litter boxes. This is the best type of cat litter I've ever used. The bucket is lighter than a bucket of standard litter. It makes scooping thru the litter much easier, and it lasts a long time. I just have to top it off a little every week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Hymie Glickmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Really light
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a disposible litter box as we were prepping to move. I have trouble lifting traditional litter containers of this size, but this really is lightweight litter so it’s much easier. It is easy slung to the four corners of the room, but that’s pretty much a given with this type of litter. It did have really good odor control.
customer_reviews.author: L. B. Bernsen

customer_reviews.title: it's scented
customer_reviews.text: it's scented, which I dislike. I wish this was explicitly stated in the product description. no dust, but yes tracking. my cats are not picky so they use it, which is good - but they smell like perfume afterwards. this is the 5th litter I try and it looks like I'll keep on searching for the one.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Dusty Prints
customer_reviews.text: This litter works well with odors and it is light weight, but it leaves a dusty residue on my cat's feet that gets tracked throughout my house. I have hardwood floors throughout my house and I find little light grey cat prints on the floor on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: The lightweight is nice because it makes it easy to move around but ...
customer_reviews.text: The lightweight is nice because it makes it easy to move around but also a curse because it gets EVERYWHERE and easily sticks to kitty paws. Also it doesn't have any of the odor fighting agents that many other tidy cats litters do so I'll stick with the other ones in the future
customer_reviews.author: Kbels

customer_reviews.title: Better litter out there
customer_reviews.text: This litter didn't seem to work as well as the Arm and Hammer brand.
customer_reviews.author: JLJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful I am however it is incredibly painful is scratchy. Just putting it on with a one minute my arms were broke out in a huge rash. Was very disappointed as I had planned on taking these on a trip. Had to send them right back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat coughing from litter dust
customer_reviews.text: It most definitely is lightweight, but there's so much dust that my kitten has been coughing and the dust also chokes me when I clean it. Don't recommend this litter, the regular kind of the same brand was better, less dust.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Too dusty!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE that I could get this heavy thing shipped for free using Amazon Prime...but...this is the dustiest litter I have ever used. There is a layer of dust all over the bathroom because of this product. Tidy Cats has another version of their lightweight litter (blue label) that is almost dust free. I could not get a good value on that version here so I am going to try another brand. Lightweight - AWESOME Dust - you will choke on it.
customer_reviews.author: NJL

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight litter has downsides.
customer_reviews.text: This litter tracks pretty badly. When we use this littler, we get litter-colored paw prints around the litterbox and it gets kicked around pretty badly by the cats. It's also fairly dusty. On the plus side, it clumps well and I love lighter weight, but this litter does not perform as well as the classic, full weight Tidy Cats litter.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Remaker

customer_reviews.title: Dust Bowl Litter.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm giving this litter two stars is for being lightweight and clumping well. The moderate amount of tracking I could live with as we use mats that catch litter wel,l but it was the excessive dust that drove us to switch litters after using three buckets of Tidy Cats. Switched to Clump and Seal lightweight and so far no dust problems.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter I have every used
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 elderly cats and this is the best cat litter I have ever used. Worth the extra money. The litter box cleans up easily and icky bits don't stick to the scoop. The light weight product is easy to pour in the litter box. The box does not smell as much as other litters I have tried including Tidy Cats regular litter.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good litter, but tracks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good litter. It doesn't keep down odor as well as I'd hoped and, since it's so light lightweight, it tends to stick to the cats' paws more, so it gets tracked farther. I find litter 2 rooms from the litter box. I love the weight of it because I have chronic back pain. It takes only a minute to thoroughly clean the box.
customer_reviews.author: fortherelax

customer_reviews.title: The light weight is great. I have always cleaned my cat's litter box ...
customer_reviews.text: The light weight is great. I have always cleaned my cat's litter box daily to avoid odors. The product I used before was better at masking fresh urine smell than this product. However, the other product was more expensive and definitely much heavier. My cat adjusted to this product without issue.
customer_reviews.author: VNR

customer_reviews.title: Reduced Odor-Easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: My cats like, and I like it because it clumps up fast so it is easily cleaned and it reduces urine odor well. The only con is that this product produces a very fine dust that requires daily dusting with a damp paper or cloth towel-but that can be said about every cat litter sold today so it gets five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Client

customer_reviews.title: Love Tidy Cats
customer_reviews.text: Everyone feels personally about kitty litter and their likes/dislikes but I think, with our two big cats, we really needed a great clumping litter which made it easy to clean up the mess and NOT have to refill the litter boxes between uses. Tidy cats is our go to--Glade, 24/7 performance, multi cats, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Too lite sticks to kitty’s bottom
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be too lite and not very good about smell relief. My cat has litter that sticks to her fur like lint. But not the worst will go back to my old litter it’s heavier but works better
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stolz

customer_reviews.title: Great for my aching back
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff for an older person who loves his cat. Not as heavy so carrying it and then the after product is much easier. My cat doesn't notice either as it is just as absorbent and makes great clumps so it is easy to clean. Best stuff for a guy with abad back you can d=find for a cat lover.
customer_reviews.author: Garbuncle

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it better than other litters
customer_reviews.text: Cat likes it better than other litters. It is lighter. Wear a dust mask when you scoop...... crazy dusty. I like it enough to put up with it. Will be a deal breaker for some.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morse

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This litter is better than the cheap alternatives. The lightness is nice, and surprisingly it clumps a lot better than other clumping litter I've tried, so it lasts about twice as long since there is much more usable litter left after you scoop out the box.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Bad Kitty Litter
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst litter I have used. It does not block ordor. If anything it makes it worst. Take my advice and buy a different kind. I even tried mixing it with boxes of baking soda and scooping twice a day. No help.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica2912

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't like it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS litter!! But a few of our cats DO NOT so they poo outside of the litter box and ON MY BED!! It didn't start happening until we changed to this litter. We have 9 cats & this never happened before. I'm saddened that I will have to change back to the heavier tidy cat litter. 😭
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Two cats, less pee-you (same amount of actual pee)
customer_reviews.text: I like this version of tidy cats the best! Lightweight and fragrance. I have the red label/lid and that works best for me. So happy with the lightweight product! Easy to scoop and exchange the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Suz

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bad smell away and it's light and easy to scoop ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the bad smell away and it's light and easy to scoop but the tracking problem is real. I have three cats and the laundy's floor where the closed poop tray is always covered with this litter. Moving to another brand next time...
customer_reviews.author: JCohen

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly satisfactory but the strong fruity fragrance is unpleasant
customer_reviews.text: It works well, and I like the light-weight litters better than the regular-weight ones. But this litter has a strong, fruity fragrance. All the humans in my household really dislike the fragrance. Fortunately, it doesn't deter our cats from using the box. Also, not quite dust-free as claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Social science professor

customer_reviews.title: I love this kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: I love this kitty litter. It doesn't smell ( the perfumed litter is not good for your cats) & it's lightweight. I keep a scoop inside the litter box so all I have to do is fill the scoop and sprinkle it in the litter box to keep it at the recommended level. I sweep up the litter on the floor to keep the bathroom clean, which is necessary for all litters I've used.. My Siamese & I are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well, low dust, smells great
customer_reviews.text: Best cat litter I’ve ever used. One container usually lasts about 1.5 months. It clumps really, really well and smells great. As long as the cat box is scooped before it’s over full you can’t smell it. Low dust too. LOVE that it weighs half what normal cat litter weighs.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Anybody that has indoor cats should try Purina Tidy Cat Light Weight Litter.
customer_reviews.text: Was so glad to find the 17.5 tubs still avaiable online and at such an affordable price too. Most of the stores we use to purchase these from quit stocking this size and only carry the 8 pound buckets and costs about as much as we get the tubs here. The quality of the product goes without saying but I Wil, really, really like this compared to any other; very little dust, clumps nicely, covers odor and works for multiple cats in one box. Thank you Purina
customer_reviews.author: vickster

customer_reviews.title: great preformance
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard to find item in my local grocery stores. A girlfriend suggested that I look on Amazon for my cat's needs and I'm thrilled to say that this was exactly what I was looking for, The performance of this kitty litter is astounding, especially when you have 3 cats!
customer_reviews.author: The Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Nice smell, easy to scoop litter
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite cat litter so far. It is light and easy to scoop. The smell reminds me of grape soda. The cats like it. It does get on the floor, but very little. For those of you with arthritis, this one doesn't hurt to scoop. I like it all around. A customer in Walmart recommended it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I like about it was the light weight
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't trap oder very well. Only thing I like about it was the light weight. I have only 1 cat, she has 2 litter boxes to use, and after 2 weeks daily scooping and slight refreshing with fresh litter on top isn't enough to mask the cat pee oder, has to be completely dumped and refilled
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgrrlie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and gets EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: yeah it’s light for me to lift but it is so light my cat tracks it everywhere. It is driving me insane! It was all over my couch and floors. The other heavy litter never did this. I am switching back.
customer_reviews.author: Mom.Nurse.Wife.08

customer_reviews.title: Arrived open!
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. Lately I have had lots of issues with delivery and items arriving intact. This was open and trailed into the house and onto the floor. pain in the ass
customer_reviews.author: SatterCat

customer_reviews.title: Not at all dust free
customer_reviews.text: I like the light idea but was disappointed as I have never seen any similar product so prone to fill the air with dust and the package claims the opposite. Whether I am scooping it or the cats are using it the air is full of it. If your nose is as sensitive as mine stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L. Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy scooping cat poop with this litter
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly refreshing product. Really enjoy scooping cat poop with this litter, sincerely. Have never had a better experience scooping poop. 5 out of 5 for fun. 5 out of 5 for dirty. 5 out of 5 I love it. P.S. This litter is light enough to allow your wife to pick to carry it inside. #nostruggle P.P.S My wife still makes me carry it in side #sad
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Horrible wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even deserve a one star litter all over house. Does not absorb odor. Stick with the 24-7 normal weight that is 5 stars threw in trash
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight litter is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a store brand lightweight litter but decided to give the name brand a shot. This tracks so much less than the store brand and I love not having to lug 40 lbs of litter around the house to fill up each litter box. I'm sure the UPS guy likes this one a lot better too!
customer_reviews.author: Kenya

customer_reviews.title: Love the weight, not so great at odor control
customer_reviews.text: I've used Tidy Cats products for years, and only buy the Lightweight litter when on sale since it costs more than regular litter. My only complaint with this litter is that is does a poor job of controlling odor. I do like that a tub this size is more manageable than regular litter.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good but SCENTED
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this litter to be scented. I'm not a fan of scented litter since it just makes used litter worse. Nothing on the packaging says scented either. I'm very sensitive to artificial smells so it's very annoying. Otherwise it clumps as expected. It doesn't get stuck in corners or the bottom of the pan. Were it not for the scent it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good litter and odor control. Wish the container was easier to open the first time. I don't have enough hand strength and have to have the help of a neighbor. Of course I could go back to the smaller size container and spend more per oz.
customer_reviews.author: Grace L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not for me!
customer_reviews.text: I like how light it is, but the smell is horrendous and the fumes smell bad. I prefer unscented. I ordered this because the Dr. Elsey's Precious Cat Ultra had gone way up in price. I found a better price on that on Chewy.com and won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L Marion

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just great. I scoop out twice a week because that's how often the trash man comes, and there's virtually no odor at all. Clumping works well. Cat likes it. I'll be hard pressed to ever change to anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Chase the Amazon Customer
